pullRequest.title: MekHQ 1892: MegaMek Standardization of Launch Game Dialogs
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR standardizes and reduces repeated code by turning the Launch/Connect to Game dialogs into inheriting a single method that has a verification method within.
This is the MegaMek-side of fixing MegaMek/mekhq#1892 and standardizing the dialogs between the two programs.

commit.message: Continuing minor cleanups with the HostDialog
Starting to implement launch game changes
Continuing to work on standardizing the localizations
Reverting messages changes in the code

nodes.bodyText: Is it intentional not to log the ex.getMessage()? Otherwise, the String error of line 596 could be re-used in 553 and 555

My feeling would be (not because it's important right here, more as a matter principle) that InitComponents might rather be
"protected JPanel createMainPanel() { ... }"
Everything from "add(middlePanel..." to center() (lines 71-77) would then move to the AbstractGCD and in the subclass it would just "return middlePanel;" instead. In this way the subclass can create whatever it wants in that panel and just return it and it does not have to "remember" doing anything (e.g. to createButtons()).
Of course, this forces createbuttons() on the subclasses but I suppose that's the buttons we need for a game conection dialog...
I mean this purely as a suggestion.
